articles.author: Johann Cherian, Bansari Kamdar
articles.description: Wall Street rose on Monday with key benchmarks set to end July higher on upbeat company earnings and hopes of a soft landing for a resilient U.S. economy, while cooling inflation fuels bets on a rate-hike pause.
articles.title: Wall St inches up, eyes monthly gain on U.S. soft landing hopes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: X, the social media company formerly known as Twitter, said on Monday that owner Elon Musk will lead the product and engineering teams, while its Chief Executive Linda Yaccarino will lead all other teams including legal and sales.
articles.title: X reveals reporting structure under Elon Musk, CEO Yaccarino

articles.author: Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Economic sanctions have been the biggest headache for Russia's business elite since the start of the war in Ukraine, but a drone strike in the heart of Moscow's financial district is forcing companies to think about their employees' safety.
articles.title: War comes to Russian business after drones strike Moscow's financial centre

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Frank Siragusa was not happy that the Mexican Pizza he paid $5.49 for at a Taco Bell in New York City last September appeared to contain only half as much beef and bean filling as the photo in the chain's advertising. So he sued.
articles.title: Taco Bell is sued for false advertising of Crunchwraps, Mexican pizzas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China on Monday announced export controls on some drone-related equipment, saying it wanted to safeguard "national security and interests" amid escalating tension with the United States over access to technology.
articles.title: China curbs exports of drone-related equipment amid U.S. tech tension

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has charged online entrepreneur Richard Heart with illegally raising more than $1 billion in three unregistered cryptocurrency offerings, and defrauding investors out of $12.1 million to buy luxuries including the world's largest black diamond.
articles.title: US SEC says Hex crypto founder defrauded investors, spent money on 'Enigma' diamond

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets
articles.description: They rode into a kill zone. The timing was off. Many men were lost. In the end, they recaptured the ruined village of Staromaiorske, claiming Ukraine's biggest advance for weeks.
articles.title: 'The Russians were waiting for us': Ukraine troops describe tougher fight than expected

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: A Georgia judge on Monday rejected former U.S. President Donald Trump's bid to quash an investigation into whether he illegally interfered with the state's 2020 election, just days before criminal charges are expected to be filed.
articles.title: Trump's bid to quash Georgia probe rejected by judge as charges loom

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) filed a lawsuit on Monday on behalf of Oklahoma residents asking a state court judge to block the creation of the nation's first religious public charter school.
articles.title: Lawsuit seeks to block first publicly funded religious school in US
